refsect2.title: GTK_STYLE_ATTACHED()
refsect2.programlisting: #define GTK_STYLE_ATTACHED(style) (GTK_STYLE (style)->attach_count > 0)
refsect2.para: Returns whether the style is attached to a window.

refsect2.title: GtkStyle
gtk_style_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkStyle* gtk_style_new (void);
refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkStyle.

refsect2.title: gtk_style_copy ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkStyle* gtk_style_copy (GtkStyle *style);
refsect2.para: Creates a copy of the passed in GtkStyle object.

refsect2.title: gtk_style_attach ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkStyle* gtk_style_attach (GtkStyle *style, GdkWindow *window);
refsect2.para: Attaches a style to a window; this process allocates the colors and creates the GC's for the style - it specializes it to a particular visual and colormap. The process may involve the creation of a new style if the style has already been attached to a window with a different style and colormap.
Since this function may return a new object, you have to use it in the following way: style = gtk_style_attach (style, window)

listitem.simpara: Either style, or a newly-created GtkStyle. If the style is newly created, the style parameter will be unref'ed, and the new style will have a reference count belonging to the caller.

refsect2.title: gtk_style_detach ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_style_detach (GtkStyle *style);
refsect2.para: Detaches a style from a window. If the style is not attached to any windows anymore, it is unrealized. See gtk_style_attach().

refsect2.title: gtk_style_ref ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkStyle* gtk_style_ref (GtkStyle *style);

warning.para: gtk_style_ref has been deprecated since version 2.0 and should not be used in newly-written code. use g_object_ref() instead.

refsect2.para: Increase the reference count of style.

warning.para: gtk_style_unref has been deprecated since version 2.0 and should not be used in newly-written code. use g_object_unref() instead.

refsect2.para: Decrease the reference count of style.

refsect2.title: gtk_style_lookup_color ()
refsect2.para: Looks up color_name in the style's logical color mappings, filling in color and returning TRUE if found, otherwise returning FALSE. Do not cache the found mapping, because it depends on the GtkStyle and might change when a theme switch occurs.

listitem.simpara: the name of the logical color to look up
TRUE if the mapping was found.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_style_lookup_icon_set ()
refsect2.programlisting: GtkIconSet* gtk_style_lookup_icon_set (GtkStyle *style, const gchar *stock_id);
refsect2.para: Looks up stock_id in the icon factories associated with style and the default icon factory, returning an icon set if found, otherwise NULL.

refsect2.title: gtk_style_render_icon ()
refsect2.programlisting: GdkPixbuf* gtk_style_render_icon (GtkStyle *style, const GtkIconSource *source, GtkTextDirection direction, GtkStateType state, GtkIconSize size, GtkWidget *widget, const gchar *detail);
refsect2.para: Renders the icon specified by source at the given size according to the given parameters and returns the result in a pixbuf.

listitem.simpara: the GtkIconSource specifying the icon to render
the size to render the icon at. A size of (GtkIconSize)-1 means render at the size of the source and don't scale.
a newly-created GdkPixbuf containing the rendered icon

refsect2.title: gtk_style_get_font ()

warning.para: gtk_style_get_font is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Gets the GdkFont to use for the given style. This is meant only as a replacement for direct access to style->font and should not be used in new code. New code should use style->font_desc instead.

refsect2.title: The "unrealize" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkStyle *style, gpointer user_data) : Run First
refsect2.para: Emitted when the aspects of the style specific to a particular colormap and depth are being cleaned up. A connection to this signal can be useful if a widget wants to cache objects like a GdkGC as object data on GtkStyle. This signal provides a convenient place to free such cached objects.

user data set when the signal handler was connected.
